pros: You get to work with students every day, helping them plan out their schedules and figure out what would be the best fit for them both academics wise and career-wise.  If you're full-time, you get tuition remission up to a certain amount and great benefits.
cons: Depending on who your supervisor is, it can take some time before some small things can be addressed, like having a printer ordered.  Also, the IT department is very change-averse, so it takes forever for new technical tools to roll out because they hate change.  Parking can be a challenge, and it can take some time to get processes done because the university still prefers physical paper trails and not electronic documents.

job_title: Adjunct Chemistry Instructor in Florence, AL
pros: Safe and friendly location, near the beautiful Tennessee River and downtown Florence, AL, which is small but lively.  Big annual blues and Renaissance festivals.  Great restaurants and shops within walking distance of campus.
cons: Under-resourced chemistry department.  Low pay for adjuncts (that's nothing new anywhere).  Lecture and lab courses could be better coordinated.  Not enough healthy food options on campus.  Some parts of campus don't feel entirely safe at night.

pros: Having a job that works with student schedules is never a bad experience!
cons: The local economy has ZERO redeeming value. When attending UNA PLAN AHEAD to RELOCATE IMMEDIATELY upon graduation - especially if you have student loans ready to go into repayment.

pros: Wonderful benefits - If single no cost for insurance on vision, dental, or health. In state teacher's retirement system. Tier 1 and Tier 2 TRA are both competitive in comparison with the market. Pay is average for being a public institution. Culture is great and atmosphere is positive. Long-term employees at this organization because it's a great career.
cons: Being in the public sector, pay is not as high as private sector. Hard to move up because everyone here stays until they retire! (not necessarily a bad thing if you are at the top)

pros:
Great benefits.
Peaceful city.
Great weather.
Good working environment. 
Colleagues are reasonable and respectful of each other
Because of the relative small size of the city and the University, most people will know you by your name, which can be a pro or a con depending on your personality.
cons:
Politics
Florence is peaceful but a very small city
UNA is on proration so bonuses or pay increases are out of question

review_title: Needs an bit of investigation into both Academic and Non-Academic Department Supervisors.
pros: It is one of the higher paying employers in the area. 99% of the employers in the area pay below national average for the same experience level/ position and UNA does as well. The cost of living in the area is typically lower and thus this makes sense.
cons: The pay is about 10 years behind the national average. Lots of corruption, so it would seem by long term employees. Misappropriations of funds happen all the the time. Student complaints are generally brushed under the rug if possible by people that seem to simply have other priorities (especially in regards to public safety, sexual harassment, and bullying of foreign students). Many of the department supervisors are not qualified for there position when compared to other Universities and therefor seem to push their own job responsibilities on employees that work beneath them.  Some department supervisors have been known to  monitor university emails and cell phones ( not sure if that is illegal, just be careful if you have a University cell phone that your boss isn't viewing personal/ family texts, photos, etc. ).  From the second you get a job here, start looking for another University to work for. Use this place as a very short term stepping stone towards a better opportunity and you should be okay. Never stay for more than 1 year.

job_title: Assistant to Vice President in Florence, AL
pros: Benefits, culture, environment are great! Employees have the opportunity to have input into major decisions because of the "Shared Governance" concept. Tuition remission for employees, their spouses and children is very good.
cons: The general economy in Northwest Alabama is not good. It could be difficult for a spouse to obtain meaningful employment in this area other than the University.

pros: Inexpensive area to live, working with students
cons: Extremely difficult to get hired here unless you know the right people, office politics is a big problem, faculty pay scale is set across the university based on academic rank which means that some faculty are overpaid for their areas (humanities) while others are underpaid (business, sciences)
